topic.para: You can run mdadm as a daemon in the monitor mode to monitor your software RAID. In the monitor mode, mdadm performs regular checks on the array for disk failures. If there is a failure, mdadm sends an email to the administrator. To define the time interval of the checks, run the following command:
The command above turns on monitoring of the /dev/md2 array in intervals of 1800 seconds. In the event of a failure, an email will be sent to root@localhost.

note.title: RAID checks are enabled by default
note.para: The RAID checks are enabled by default. It may happen that the interval between each check is not long enough and you may encounter warnings. Thus, you can increase the interval by setting a higher value with the delay option.
